newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH '97 REAL EARNINGS SEEN UP 3.5 PCT - TUPOSETO.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH '97 REAL EARNINGS SEEN UP 3.5 PCT - TUPOSETO.

text.p: Finnish workers' disposable real earnings were expected to increase 3.5 percent in 1997 after rising four percent in 1996, the incomes policy working group (Tuposeto) said in a statement on Friday.
The rise in the earnings index would slow to 0.8 percent year-on-year in the final quarter of 1997 from a rise of 3.4 percent in Q4, 1996, Tuposeto said.
In December 1997, the year-on-year rise in the consumer price index would be 1.5 percent. On average, the rise in consumer prices in 1997 would be one percent, the group said.
Manufacturing industry's price competitiveness measured by unit labour costs would improve by 3.5 percent this year after rising three percent in 1996, it said.
The price competitiveness level would rise this year to over 25 percent above the log-term average. In this forecast, the markka was assumed to remain at its end-April levels.
On April 30, the markka closed at 3.0030 against the German mark, at 5.1985 against the dollar and at 0.6624 against the Swedish crown. The ECU index reading was 100.54.
Tuposeto, chaired by Martti Hetemaki, head of the finance ministry's economics department, is made up of top economists from the ministry, central trade unions and major employer confederations.
Their reports on wage, price and earnings trends are used as a base for incomes bargaining.
Their next report is due in November and will be used in talks on a new pay deal from February 1998 onwards.
